intro: Chorizanthe dasyantha, commonly known as the hairy cholla, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its spiny stems and clusters of small, greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as deserts and rocky soils, where it thrives with minimal water. Its leaves are usually reduced to small scales, and it produces seeds that are dispersed by wind. Chorizanthe dasyantha is well adapted to harsh conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
